questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A RESTCONF GET request is sent to a Cisco IOS XE device. The base URL of the request and the response in XML format are shown in the exhibit. What is the YANG data node that is referenced in the response?

discussion.content:
CD
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/wireless/mse/8-0/MSE_REST_API/Guide/Cisco_MSE_REST_API_Guide/REST_Introduction.pdf

Selected Answer: CD
- why not E?

Parameters are not being passed via HTTP Headers
GET - parameters are part of the URL
POST - parameters part of the DATA payload

comments.content: this is not a defining characteristic of REST

discussion.content: why not E

questions.question_text: What are two characteristics of REST API calls? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Ans is D

Answer is D
Simply knowing how a for loop works
Yes D. This is how for loop works.

choices.B: The stream type must be set to YANG.
choices.D: The sender IP address must be set.
choices.C: The update policy period must be shortened.
choices.A: The IP address of the receiver must be set.

discussion.content: A. The IP address of the receiver must be set.

Selected Answer: A
Answer was A, refer https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/prog/configuration/176/b_176_programmability_cg/m_176_prog_ietf_telemetry.html#id_90962
Must be defined IP of collector.

Answer is A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/prog/configuration/167/b_167_programmability_cg/model_driven_telemetry.html

tldr: A

long version:
I think A should be the right answer. If you check the reference link yang-push and periodic 6000 are valid options. Sender IP could be any configured interface, but receiver IP has to be configured.
Laith_A why the different answers? I would think A?

comments.content: Receiver is the sender, it should be A

discussion.content: Answer is D, a receiver ip is must be added
answer is C

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The configuration commands are entered in CLI config mode to configure a static telemetry subscription on a Cisco IOS XE device. The commands are accepted by the device, but the consumer receives no telemetry data. Which change must be made to ensure that the consumer receives the telemetry data?
